title: Information Disclosure - Server Technology Fingerprinting via HTTP Headers
description: The application discloses detailed server technology information in HTTP response headers. The Server header reveals "Werkzeug/3.1.3 Python/3.13.3", exposing both the WSGI framework version and Python version. This information can be used by attackers to identify known vulnerabilities in specific versions. The vulnerability is present across all tested endpoints including the root path, /xss25, and /xss3.
impact: An attacker can use this information to research and identify known vulnerabilities affecting Werkzeug 3.1.3 and Python 3.13.3. This significantly reduces the attacker's reconnaissance effort and increases the likelihood of successful exploitation of version-specific vulnerabilities. The attacker can target known CVEs in these specific versions without performing version detection themselves.
evidence:
POC execution confirmed technology fingerprinting vulnerability:

1. Server header disclosed on all endpoints:
   - GET http://localhost:5001/ returns: Server: Werkzeug/3.1.3 Python/3.13.3
   - GET http://localhost:5001/xss25 returns: Server: Werkzeug/3.1.3 Python/3.13.3
   - GET http://localhost:5001/xss3 returns: Server: Werkzeug/3.1.3 Python/3.13.3

2. Extracted version information:
   - Framework: Werkzeug v3.1.3
   - Language: Python v3.13.3

3. POC Script Output:
   All three endpoints returned identical Server headers, confirming consistent information disclosure across the entire application.
